reviewText: This was the second of Steven Bochco's hit TV series, the first being "Hill Street Blues". It was set in and around the fictitious Los Angeles law firm McKenzie, Brackman, Cheney and Kuzak and featured attorneys at the firm and various members of the support staff and dealt with important social and cultural issues the times, with its first season starting in 1986. As a result, it seems very much dated and tied to the times in which it aired in a way that Bochco's other series do not. That might be part of the reason for the delay in releasing this series to DVD, although Bochco's other hit shows have been slow to be released on DVD too.In the first season you get a glimpse of a very young Jimmy Smits playing newly hired associate Victor Sifuentes. Also, real-life husband and wife Michael Tucker and Jill Eikenberry play a beauty and the beast type couple working at the firm that begin dating, including the much talked about "Venus Butterfly", also from this season. Also, this was the time when Grace Van Owen and Michael Kuzak still were OK to watch as a couple constantly dancing around commitment, about a year before their relationship became boring to watch because it never seemed to grow or change. Overall, I'd say the quick pace of the show, the interesting cases, and the great cast outweigh the dated issues raised.
summary: A stellar first season that is very much tied to the 80's
Title: N/A

reviewText: L.A. Law was the best TV show of the late '80s-early '90s.  I've been waiting years for the entire run of the show to be released on DVD; and I agree with J.Altair -- it should be released as a complete boxed set instead of a season at a time.  C'mon, 20th Century Fox and Bochco...stop depriving us 'Law' fans of seeing these shows on DVD!  Release it now!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This was an amazing and some what ground breaking show. Please bring this series to either DVD or even better - streaming!  There is money to be made so there has to be a way!

reviewText: Like many others, I can't wait for it to be released on DVD. I would prefer all seasons being released in a complete box-set to start with instead of each season being released individually first.If you agree with me please vote that this review was helpful.  That way the distributors may consider this before the release. Thanks.EDIT (4/4/10):So now we have a situation where it has been discontinued even though it has never been released? Come on Amazon, we expect a better explanation than that please.

reviewText: I have never see this show before.  I was born in 85 so it was before I watched shows like it.  I do however watch Psych.  I was watching the extra features on the psych season one set and Corbin Bernsen was saying he has not been in a show he liked so much since L.A Law.  That made me want to see the show.  I read a little about it and it seems like a good show.  Only time will tell.  But seeing as it is not even out yet and it got 5 out of 5 by fans.  Well that pretty much speaks for itself.
summary: I have wanted to see this for a while.

reviewText: I was a kid when I started watching this show in the 80s. The show inspired me to go to law school and become a lawyer. "The Practice" comes in a close second. I hope the studios release the DVD soon.
summary: Best courtroom tv show of all time

reviewText: I share the view of all the others before me- please release this wonderful show on DVD.  It is one of the best shows ever produced in the 80's and it would certainly compete well with anything on television now!

reviewText: They got obscure shows from the 70s on DVD, why is this not out yet?They either butcher the DVDs so that they become unrecognizable (like take out music, see 21 Jump Street, Dawson's Creek, The Fall Guys etc) or they dont release a series at all (Who's the Boss?, LA Law, The wonder Years) because of some outdated copyright issues regarding the music. Big fail. As usual it is all about money and not the art.
summary: How in the world is this not on DVD yet?
Title: N/A

reviewText: L.A. Law, Thirty-Something, China Beach and Knots Landing were some of the best shows on television EVER.  They all need to be released in complete sets as soon as possible.  Season by season is painstaking and it seems never completed.  The technology is available, the audience is eagerly waiting.  So .. let's get cracking and have these awesome shows released in full.
summary: Time for the 80s shows to be released...
